title: Variable Encoder — encode_variables
text: df data frame encoded. vars character vector variables data frame recoded using randomized numeric value. tag boolean, TRUE recoded value prefixed variable name underscore (e.g., 'varname_123'). Defaults FALSE.

title: Variable Encoder — encode_variables

text: input_df data.frame summarized codebook. return_df boolean set default TRUE, FALSE return table HTML LaTeX. format string set NULL default. NULL return_df parameter set FALSE, argument may set "html" "latex" determine output table. escape boolean; whether escape special characters producing HTML LaTeX tables. escape = FALSE, make sure special characters trigger syntax errors LaTeX HTML. extra_vars data.frame variables wil left joined. extra_key character; specifying column used merging extra_vars table. ... arguments (see Examples References).

title: Codebook Maker — make_codebook
code: if (FALSE) { # Create a test data.frame test <- data.frame("Incident_Type" = c("WSP", "WMCI", "WHF", "WWC", "WHCC",                                          "WSP", "WMCI", "WHF", "WWC", "WHCC"),  "n" = seq(1, 10),  "n2" = as.double( seq(11, 20) ),  "string" = c(LETTERS[1:10]),  "test2" = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C", "C", "D", "E", "F", "A"),  "factor" = as.factor(rep(letters[1:5], 2)),  "test" = c(rep(TRUE, 6), FALSE, NA, NA, NA)  )  # Return HTML table. codemaker(test, return_df =  FALSE, format = "html",  latex_options = "striped", escape = FALSE, extra_vars = added_vars,  extra_key = "var_name")  }

title: Visualize Single Variable — visualize_sngl_var
text: df data frame variable visualized. var character representing name single variable given data frame. xlab required character value representing label placed x-axis. may asking, need provide variable named also required. Simply, user can explicitly decide variable label printed users. ylab optional character representing label placed y-axis. theme ggplot theme used tweak display graph. widget boolean defaults FALSE. TRUE, graph returned interactive HTML widget powered plotly library. flip boolean defaults FALSE. TRUE, graph turned axis. cutoff numeric value used select number variables graphed working categorical data. value intended limit amount bars plotted make graphs legible. Defaults value 30. ... arguments passed geom, labs, ggplotly, plotly config functions.

title: Visualize Single Variable — visualize_sngl_var
code: if (FALSE) { d <- data.frame(   "char" = rep(LETTERS[1:5], 10),   "ints" = rep(c(1L, 2L), 25)  )   visualize_sngl_var(d, "ints", widget = TRUE, xlab = "Integers",    ylab ="Count") }
